6.verse: Yet, because I have spoken these things to you, sorrow has filled your heart.

7.verse: Nevertheless, I am telling you the truth. It is for your benefit that I go away, because if I don’t go away the Counselor will not come to you. If I go, I will send Him to you.

8.verse: When He comes, He will convict the world about sin, righteousness, and judgment:

9.verse: About sin, because they do not believe in Me;

10.verse: about righteousness, because I am going to the Father and you will no longer see Me;

11.verse: and about judgment, because the ruler of this world has been judged.

12.verse: “I still have many things to tell you, but you can’t bear them now.

13.verse: When the Spirit of truth comes, He will guide you into all the truth. For He will not speak on His own, but He will speak whatever He hears. He will also declare to you what is to come.

14.verse: He will glorify Me, because He will take from what is Mine and declare it to you.

15.verse: Everything the Father has is Mine. This is why I told you that He takes from what is Mine and will declare it to you.

16.verse: Sorrow Turned to Joy - “A little while and you will no longer see Me; again a little while and you will see Me.”

17.verse: Therefore some of His disciples said to one another, “What is this He tells us: ‘A little while and you will not see Me; again a little while and you will see Me’; and, ‘because I am going to the Father’?”

18.verse: They said, “What is this He is saying, ‘A little while’? We don’t know what He’s talking about!”

19.verse: Jesus knew they wanted to question Him, so He said to them, “Are you asking one another about what I said, ‘A little while and you will not see Me; again a little while and you will see Me’?

20.verse: “I assure you: You will weep and wail, but the world will rejoice. You will become sorrowful, but your sorrow will turn to joy.

21.verse: When a woman is in labor she has pain because her time has come. But when she has given birth to a child, she no longer remembers the suffering because of the joy that a person has been born into the world.

22.verse: So you also have sorrow now. But I will see you again. Your hearts will rejoice, and no one will rob you of your joy.

23.verse: In that day you will not ask Me anything. “I assure you: Anything you ask the Father in My name, He will give you.

24.verse: Until now you have asked for nothing in My name. Ask and you will receive, so that your joy may be complete.

25.verse: Jesus the Victor - “I have spoken these things to you in figures of speech. A time is coming when I will no longer speak to you in figures, but I will tell you plainly about the Father.

26.verse: In that day you will ask in My name. I am not telling you that I will make requests to the Father on your behalf.

27.verse: For the Father Himself loves you, because you have loved Me and have believed that I came from God.

28.verse: I came from the Father and have come into the world. Again, I am leaving the world and going to the Father.”

29.verse: “Ah!” His disciples said. “Now You’re speaking plainly and not using any figurative language.

30.verse: Now we know that You know everything and don’t need anyone to question You. By this we believe that You came from God.”

31.verse: Jesus responded to them, “Do you now believe?

32.verse: Look: An hour is coming, and has come, when each of you will be scattered to his own home, and you will leave Me alone. Yet I am not alone, because the Father is with Me.

33.verse: I have told you these things so that in Me you may have peace. You will have suffering in this world. Be courageous! I have conquered the world.”

1.verse: Jesus Prays for Himself - Jesus spoke these things, looked up to heaven, and said: Father, the hour has come. Glorify Your Son so that the Son may glorify You,

2.verse: for You gave Him authority over all flesh; so He may give eternal life to all You have given Him.

3.verse: This is eternal life: that they may know You, the only true God, and the One You have sent—Jesus Christ.

4.verse: I have glorified You on the earth by completing the work You gave Me to do.

5.verse: Now, Father, glorify Me in Your presence with that glory I had with You before the world existed.

6.verse: Jesus Prays for His Disciples - I have revealed Your name to the men You gave Me from the world. They were Yours, You gave them to Me, and they have kept Your word.

7.verse: Now they know that all things You have given to Me are from You,

8.verse: because the words that You gave Me, I have given them. They have received them and have known for certain that I came from You. They have believed that You sent Me.

9.verse: I pray for them. I am not praying for the world but for those You have given Me, because they are Yours.

10.verse: Everything I have is Yours, and everything You have is Mine, and I have been glorified in them.

11.verse: I am no longer in the world, but they are in the world, and I am coming to You. Holy Father, protect them by Your name that You have given Me, so that they may be one as We are one.

12.verse: While I was with them, I was protecting them by Your name that You have given Me. I guarded them and not one of them is lost, except the son of destruction, so that the Scripture may be fulfilled.

13.verse: Now I am coming to You, and I speak these things in the world so that they may have My joy completed in them.

14.verse: I have given them Your word. The world hated them because they are not of the world, as I am not of the world.

15.verse: I am not praying that You take them out of the world but that You protect them from the evil one.

16.verse: They are not of the world, as I am not of the world.

17.verse: Sanctify them by the truth; Your word is truth.

18.verse: As You sent Me into the world, I also have sent them into the world.

19.verse: I sanctify Myself for them, so they also may be sanctified by the truth.

20.verse: Jesus Prays for All Believers - I pray not only for these, but also for those who believe in Me through their message.

21.verse: May they all be one, as You, Father, are in Me and I am in You. May they also be one in Us, so the world may believe You sent Me.

22.verse: I have given them the glory You have given Me. May they be one as We are one.

23.verse: I am in them and You are in Me. May they be made completely one, so the world may know You have sent Me and have loved them as You have loved Me.

24.verse: Father, I desire those You have given Me to be with Me where I am. Then they will see My glory, which You have given Me because You loved Me before the world’s foundation.

25.verse: Righteous Father! The world has not known You. However, I have known You, and these have known that You sent Me.

26.verse: I made Your name known to them and will make it known, so the love You have loved Me with may be in them and I may be in them.

1.verse: Jesus Betrayed - After Jesus had said these things, He went out with His disciples across the Kidron Valley, where there was a garden, and He and His disciples went into it.

2.verse: Judas, who betrayed Him, also knew the place, because Jesus often met there with His disciples.

3.verse: So Judas took a company of soldiers and some temple police from the chief priests and the Pharisees and came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.

4.verse: Then Jesus, knowing everything that was about to happen to Him, went out and said to them, “Who is it you’re looking for?”

5.verse: “Jesus the Nazarene,” they answered. “I am He,” Jesus told them. Judas, who betrayed Him, was also standing with them.

6.verse: When He told them, “I am He,” they stepped back and fell to the ground.

7.verse: Then He asked them again, “Who is it you’re looking for?” “Jesus the Nazarene,” they said.

8.verse: “I told you I am He,” Jesus replied. “So if you’re looking for Me, let these men go.”

9.verse: This was to fulfill the words He had said: “I have not lost one of those You have given Me.”

10.verse: Then Simon Peter, who had a sword, drew it, struck the high priest’s slave, and cut off his right ear. (The slave’s name was Malchus.)

11.verse: At that, Jesus said to Peter, “Sheathe your sword! Am I not to drink the cup the Father has given Me?”

12.verse: Jesus Arrested and Taken to Annas - Then the company of soldiers, the commander, and the Jewish temple police arrested Jesus and tied Him up.

13.verse: First they led Him to Annas, for he was the father-in-law of Caiaphas, who was high priest that year.

14.verse: Caiaphas was the one who had advised the Jews that it was advantageous that one man should die for the people.

15.verse: Peter Denies Jesus - Meanwhile, Simon Peter was following Jesus, as was another disciple. That disciple was an acquaintance of the high priest; so he went with Jesus into the high priest’s courtyard.

16.verse: But Peter remained standing outside by the door. So the other disciple, the one known to the high priest, went out and spoke to the girl who was the doorkeeper and brought Peter in.

17.verse: Then the slave girl who was the doorkeeper said to Peter, “You aren’t one of this man’s disciples too, are you?” “I am not!” he said.

18.verse: Now the slaves and the temple police had made a charcoal fire, because it was cold. They were standing there warming themselves, and Peter was standing with them, warming himself.

19.verse: Jesus before Annas - The high priest questioned Jesus about His disciples and about His teaching.

20.verse: “I have spoken openly to the world,” Jesus answered him. “I have always taught in the synagogue and in the temple complex, where all the Jews congregate, and I haven’t spoken anything in secret.

21.verse: Why do you question Me? Question those who heard what I told them. Look, they know what I said.”

22.verse: When He had said these things, one of the temple police standing by slapped Jesus, saying, “Is this the way you answer the high priest?”

23.verse: “If I have spoken wrongly,” Jesus answered him, “give evidence about the wrong; but if rightly, why do you hit Me?”

24.verse: Then Annas sent Him bound to Caiaphas the high priest.

25.verse: Peter Denies Jesus Twice More - Now Simon Peter was standing and warming himself. They said to him, “You aren’t one of His disciples too, are you?” He denied it and said, “I am not!”

26.verse: One of the high priest’s slaves, a relative of the man whose ear Peter had cut off, said, “Didn’t I see you with Him in the garden?”

27.verse: Peter then denied it again. Immediately a rooster crowed.

28.verse: Jesus before Pilate - Then they took Jesus from Caiaphas to the governor’s headquarters. It was early morning. They did not enter the headquarters themselves; otherwise they would be defiled and unable to eat the Passover.

29.verse: Then Pilate came out to them and said, “What charge do you bring against this man?”

30.verse: They answered him, “If this man weren’t a criminal, we wouldn’t have handed Him over to you.”

31.verse: So Pilate told them, “Take Him yourselves and judge Him according to your law.” “It’s not legal for us to put anyone to death,” the Jews declared.

32.verse: They said this so that Jesus’ words might be fulfilled signifying what kind of death He was going to die.

33.verse: Then Pilate went back into the headquarters, summoned Jesus, and said to Him, “Are You the King of the Jews?”

34.verse: Jesus answered, “Are you asking this on your own, or have others told you about Me?”

35.verse: “I’m not a Jew, am I?” Pilate replied. “Your own nation and the chief priests handed You over to me. What have You done?”

36.verse: “My kingdom is not of this world,” said Jesus. “If My kingdom were of this world, My servants would fight, so that I wouldn’t be handed over to the Jews. As it is, My kingdom does not have its origin here.”

37.verse: “You are a king then?” Pilate asked. “You say that I’m a king,” Jesus replied. “I was born for this, and I have come into the world for this: to testify to the truth. Everyone who is of the truth listens to My voice.”

38.verse: “What is truth?” said Pilate. Jesus or Barabbas - After he had said this, he went out to the Jews again and told them, “I find no grounds for charging Him.

39.verse: You have a custom that I release one prisoner to you at the Passover. So, do you want me to release to you the King of the Jews?”

40.verse: They shouted back, “Not this man, but Barabbas!” Now Barabbas was a revolutionary.

1.verse: Jesus Flogged and Mocked - Then Pilate took Jesus and had Him flogged.

2.verse: The soldiers also twisted together a crown of thorns, put it on His head, and threw a purple robe around Him.

3.verse: And they repeatedly came up to Him and said, “Hail, King of the Jews!” and were slapping His face.

4.verse: Pilate went outside again and said to them, “Look, I’m bringing Him outside to you to let you know I find no grounds for charging Him.”

5.verse: Pilate Sentences Jesus to Death - Then Jesus came out wearing the crown of thorns and the purple robe. Pilate said to them, “Here is the man!”

6.verse: When the chief priests and the temple police saw Him, they shouted, “Crucify! Crucify!” Pilate responded, “Take Him and crucify Him yourselves, for I find no grounds for charging Him.”

7.verse: “We have a law,” the Jews replied to him, “and according to that law He must die, because He made Himself the Son of God.”

8.verse: When Pilate heard this statement, he was more afraid than ever.

9.verse: He went back into the headquarters and asked Jesus, “Where are You from?” But Jesus did not give him an answer.

10.verse: So Pilate said to Him, “You’re not talking to me? Don’t You know that I have the authority to release You and the authority to crucify You?”

11.verse: “You would have no authority over Me at all,” Jesus answered him, “if it hadn’t been given you from above. This is why the one who handed Me over to you has the greater sin.”

12.verse: From that moment Pilate made every effort to release Him. But the Jews shouted, “If you release this man, you are not Caesar’s friend. Anyone who makes himself a king opposes Caesar!”

13.verse: When Pilate heard these words, he brought Jesus outside. He sat down on the judge’s bench in a place called the Stone Pavement (but in Hebrew Gabbatha).

14.verse: It was the preparation day for the Passover, and it was about six in the morning. Then he told the Jews, “Here is your king!”

15.verse: But they shouted, “Take Him away! Take Him away! Crucify Him!” Pilate said to them, “Should I crucify your king?” “We have no king but Caesar!” the chief priests answered.

16.verse: So then, because of them, he handed Him over to be crucified. The Crucifixion - Therefore they took Jesus away.

17.verse: Carrying His own cross, He went out to what is called Skull Place, which in Hebrew is called Golgotha.

18.verse: There they crucified Him and two others with Him, one on either side, with Jesus in the middle.

19.verse: Pilate also had a sign lettered and put on the cross. The inscription was: JESUS THE NAZARENE THE KING OF THE JEWS.

20.verse: Many of the Jews read this sign, because the place where Jesus was crucified was near the city, and it was written in Hebrew, Latin, and Greek.

21.verse: So the chief priests of the Jews said to Pilate, “Don’t write, ‘The King of the Jews,’ but that He said, ‘I am the King of the Jews.’”

22.verse: Pilate replied, “What I have written, I have written.”

23.verse: When the soldiers crucified Jesus, they took His clothes and divided them into four parts, a part for each soldier. They also took the tunic, which was seamless, woven in one piece from the top.

24.verse: So they said to one another, “Let’s not tear it, but cast lots for it, to see who gets it.” They did this to fulfill the Scripture that says: They divided My clothes among themselves, and they cast lots for My clothing. And this is what the soldiers did.

25.verse: Jesus’ Provision for His Mother - Standing by the cross of Jesus were His mother, His mother’s sister, Mary the wife of Clopas, and Mary Magdalene.

26.verse: When Jesus saw His mother and the disciple He loved standing there, He said to His mother, “Woman, here is your son.”

27.verse: Then He said to the disciple, “Here is your mother.” And from that hour the disciple took her into his home.

28.verse: The Finished Work of Jesus - After this, when Jesus knew that everything was now accomplished that the Scripture might be fulfilled, He said, “I’m thirsty!”

29.verse: A jar full of sour wine was sitting there; so they fixed a sponge full of sour wine on hyssop and held it up to His mouth.

30.verse: When Jesus had received the sour wine, He said, “It is finished!” Then bowing His head, He gave up His spirit.

31.verse: Jesus’ Side Pierced - Since it was the preparation day, the Jews did not want the bodies to remain on the cross on the Sabbath (for that Sabbath was a special day). They requested that Pilate have the men’s legs broken and that their bodies be taken away.

32.verse: So the soldiers came and broke the legs of the first man and of the other one who had been crucified with Him.

33.verse: When they came to Jesus, they did not break His legs since they saw that He was already dead.

34.verse: But one of the soldiers pierced His side with a spear, and at once blood and water came out.

35.verse: He who saw this has testified so that you also may believe. His testimony is true, and he knows he is telling the truth.

36.verse: For these things happened so that the Scripture would be fulfilled: Not one of His bones will be broken.

37.verse: Also, another Scripture says: They will look at the One they pierced.

38.verse: Jesus’ Burial - After this, Joseph of Arimathea, who was a disciple of Jesus—but secretly because of his fear of the Jews—asked Pilate that he might remove Jesus’ body. Pilate gave him permission, so he came and took His body away.

39.verse: Nicodemus (who had previously come to Him at night) also came, bringing a mixture of about 75 pounds of myrrh and aloes.

40.verse: Then they took Jesus’ body and wrapped it in linen cloths with the aromatic spices, according to the burial custom of the Jews.

41.verse: There was a garden in the place where He was crucified. A new tomb was in the garden; no one had yet been placed in it.

42.verse: They placed Jesus there because of the Jewish preparation and since the tomb was nearby.

1.verse: The Empty Tomb - On the first day of the week Mary Magdalene came to the tomb early, while it was still dark. She saw that the stone had been removed from the tomb.

2.verse: So she ran to Simon Peter and to the other disciple, the one Jesus loved, and said to them, “They have taken the Lord out of the tomb, and we don’t know where they have put Him!”

3.verse: At that, Peter and the other disciple went out, heading for the tomb.

4.verse: The two were running together, but the other disciple outran Peter and got to the tomb first.

5.verse: Stooping down, he saw the linen cloths lying there, yet he did not go in.

6.verse: Then, following him, Simon Peter came also. He entered the tomb and saw the linen cloths lying there.

7.verse: The wrapping that had been on His head was not lying with the linen cloths but was folded up in a separate place by itself.

8.verse: The other disciple, who had reached the tomb first, then entered the tomb, saw, and believed.

9.verse: For they still did not understand the Scripture that He must rise from the dead.

10.verse: Then the disciples went home again.

11.verse: Mary Magdalene Sees the Risen Lord - But Mary stood outside facing the tomb, crying. As she was crying, she stooped to look into the tomb.

12.verse: She saw two angels in white sitting there, one at the head and one at the feet, where Jesus’ body had been lying.

13.verse: They said to her, “Woman, why are you crying?” “Because they’ve taken away my Lord,” she told them, “and I don’t know where they’ve put Him.”

14.verse: Having said this, she turned around and saw Jesus standing there, though she did not know it was Jesus.

15.verse: “Woman,” Jesus said to her, “why are you crying? Who is it you are looking for?” Supposing He was the gardener, she replied, “Sir, if you’ve removed Him, tell me where you’ve put Him, and I will take Him away.”

16.verse: Jesus said, “Mary.” Turning around, she said to Him in Hebrew, “Rabbouni!”—which means “Teacher.”

17.verse: “Don’t cling to Me,” Jesus told her, “for I have not yet ascended to the Father. But go to My brothers and tell them that I am ascending to My Father and your Father—to My God and your God.”

18.verse: Mary Magdalene went and announced to the disciples, “I have seen the Lord!” And she told them what He had said to her.

19.verse: The Disciples Commissioned - In the evening of that first day of the week, the disciples were gathered together with the doors locked because of their fear of the Jews. Then Jesus came, stood among them, and said to them, “Peace to you!”

20.verse: Having said this, He showed them His hands and His side. So the disciples rejoiced when they saw the Lord.

21.verse: Jesus said to them again, “Peace to you! As the Father has sent Me, I also send you.”

22.verse: After saying this, He breathed on them and said, “Receive the Holy Spirit.

23.verse: If you forgive the sins of any, they are forgiven them; if you retain the sins of any, they are retained.”

24.verse: Thomas Sees and Believes - But one of the Twelve, Thomas (called “Twin”), was not with them when Jesus came.

25.verse: So the other disciples kept telling him, “We have seen the Lord!” But he said to them, “If I don’t see the mark of the nails in His hands, put my finger into the mark of the nails, and put my hand into His side, I will never believe!”

26.verse: After eight days His disciples were indoors again, and Thomas was with them. Even though the doors were locked, Jesus came and stood among them. He said, “Peace to you!”

27.verse: Then He said to Thomas, “Put your finger here and observe My hands. Reach out your hand and put it into My side. Don’t be an unbeliever, but a believer.”

28.verse: Thomas responded to Him, “My Lord and my God!”

29.verse: Jesus said, “Because you have seen Me, you have believed. Those who believe without seeing are blessed.”

30.verse: The Purpose of This Gospel - Jesus performed many other signs in the presence of His disciples that are not written in this book.

31.verse: But these are written so that you may believe Jesus is the Messiah, the Son of God, and by believing you may have life in His name.

1.verse: Jesus’ Third Appearance to the Disciples - After this, Jesus revealed Himself again to His disciples by the Sea of Tiberias. He revealed Himself in this way:

2.verse: Simon Peter, Thomas (called “Twin”), Nathanael from Cana of Galilee, Zebedee’s sons, and two others of His disciples were together.

3.verse: “I’m going fishing,” Simon Peter said to them. “We’re coming with you,” they told him. They went out and got into the boat, but that night they caught nothing.

4.verse: When daybreak came, Jesus stood on the shore. However, the disciples did not know it was Jesus.

5.verse: “Men,” Jesus called to them, “you don’t have any fish, do you?” “No,” they answered.

6.verse: “Cast the net on the right side of the boat,” He told them, “and you’ll find some.” So they did, and they were unable to haul it in because of the large number of fish.

7.verse: Therefore the disciple, the one Jesus loved, said to Peter, “It is the Lord!” When Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he tied his outer garment around him (for he was stripped) and plunged into the sea.

8.verse: But since they were not far from land (about 100 yards away), the other disciples came in the boat, dragging the net full of fish.

9.verse: When they got out on land, they saw a charcoal fire there, with fish lying on it, and bread.

10.verse: “Bring some of the fish you’ve just caught,” Jesus told them.

11.verse: So Simon Peter got up and hauled the net ashore, full of large fish—153 of them. Even though there were so many, the net was not torn.

12.verse: “Come and have breakfast,” Jesus told them. None of the disciples dared ask Him, “Who are You?” because they knew it was the Lord.

13.verse: Jesus came, took the bread, and gave it to them. He did the same with the fish.

14.verse: This was now the third time Jesus appeared to the disciples after He was raised from the dead.

15.verse: Jesus’ Threefold Restoration of Peter - When they had eaten breakfast, Jesus asked Simon Peter, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me more than these?” “Yes, Lord,” he said to Him, “You know that I love You.” “Feed My lambs,” He told him.

16.verse: A second time He asked him, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?” “Yes, Lord,” he said to Him, “You know that I love You.” “Shepherd My sheep,” He told him.

17.verse: He asked him the third time, “Simon, son of John, do you love Me?” Peter was grieved that He asked him the third time, “Do you love Me?” He said, “Lord, You know everything! You know that I love You.” “Feed My sheep,” Jesus said.

18.verse: “I assure you: When you were young, you would tie your belt and walk wherever you wanted. But when you grow old, you will stretch out your hands and someone else will tie you and carry you where you don’t want to go.”

19.verse: He said this to signify by what kind of death he would glorify God. After saying this, He told him, “Follow Me!”

20.verse: Correcting a False Report - So Peter turned around and saw the disciple Jesus loved following them. That disciple was the one who had leaned back against Jesus at the supper and asked, “Lord, who is the one that’s going to betray You?”

21.verse: When Peter saw him, he said to Jesus, “Lord—what about him?”

22.verse: “If I want him to remain until I come,” Jesus answered, “what is that to you? As for you, follow Me.”

23.verse: So this report spread to the brothers that this disciple would not die. Yet Jesus did not tell him that he would not die, but, “If I want him to remain until I come, what is that to you?”

24.verse: Epilogue - This is the disciple who testifies to these things and who wrote them down. We know that his testimony is true.

25.verse: And there are also many other things that Jesus did, which, if they were written one by one, I suppose not even the world itself could contain the books that would be written.
